items.title: Showa 1926-1939
items.summary: Shigeru Mizuki’s Showa series is a semi-autobiographical series of manga that covers not only the major events in Japanese history…
items.content_html:
Shigeru Mizuki’s Showa series is a semi-autobiographical series of manga that covers not only the major events in Japanese history but also smaller less well-known incidents such as the Tokyo subway sarin attack and an 80s crime ring that threatened to poison candy. 

 

 

Origin

Tokyo, Japan

Shigeru Mizuki and History

The following page scans from Showa 1926-1939: A History of Japan Vol. 1 show how manga is used to illustrate both the darker and lighter events of Japanese history. Although anime and manga have grown in popularity in the West, it has been part of Japan's culture for decades and is considered serious literature - it is used in everything from education to entertainment in all facets of society and is not limited by demographics. Japanese entertainment has taken center stage in the United States and yet Americans repeatedly demonstrate sheer ignorance and disrespect towards Japan and Japanese people. 

Reflect

  • How much do you know about Japan after World War 2?  
  • Do you think Japanese comic books are an effective medium for bringing history to life? 

Explore

Mizuki, S. (2022). Showa 1926-1939: A History of Japan. Drawn and Quarterly.

Kawaguchi, A. (2019). Near past: Inside Japan's student uprisings of the 1960s. Kindle.

items.title: Pavin's book about monarchy banned in Thailand
items.summary: This Bangkok Post news article shows the hazards of criticizing the Thai monarchy and the nature of censorship in countries…
items.content_html:
This Bangkok Post news article shows the hazards of criticizing the Thai monarchy and the nature of censorship in countries such as Thailand. 

Origin

Book banning in Thailand

Thailand is notorious for strict rules regarding criticizing the government and/or the monarchy. This short article demonstrates the consequences of writing a book that includes any negative comments about both.

Bangkok Post. (2023, July 8). Pavin's book about monarchy banned in Thailand. Retrieved from Bangkok Post: https://www.bangkokpost.com/thailand/general/2608113/pavins-book-about-monarchy-banned-in-thailand

Thailand has built a mixed reputation for itself because of its tourist industry, but there is so much more to the country than its beaches, red-light district, Thai women, massages and food. Foreigners frequently abuse Thai culture and the word itself elicits a poor knee-jerk reaction. As with many Southeast Asian countries, however, Thailand is unique and vibrant with much of its literature and art reflecting a completely different world.

Reflect

  • Do you think book banning in Thailand based on monarchical rules is similar to the book banning in the United States?
  • Do you think there is any scenario where book banning is justified based on culture or law?

Explore

Manning, S. (2020). A good true Thai. Epigram Books.

Sudbanthad, P. (2019). Bangkok wakes to rain: A novel. Penguin Audio.

items.title: The Neighborhood Pump Attendant
items.summary: While it is true Singapore is considered one of the wealthiest city-states in Asia, global media coverage rarely focuses on…
items.content_html:
While it is true Singapore is considered one of the wealthiest city-states in Asia, global media coverage rarely focuses on parts of the society that do not indulge in the wealthy excesses of the Singapore elite. This short clip from CNA Insider focuses on one of these residents: the hard-working gas pump attendant.

Origin

Singapore

 

The other sight of Singapore

Singapore is small, but extremely diverse. There are wealthy expatriates from all over the world, immigrants from different parts of Asia, and Malays with mixed heritage. As with other Southeast Asian countries, Singapore has its own dubious reputation as a "nanny state", though the name of the country is always accompanied with the idea of a technocratic and grossly wealthy population. Unfortunately, the truth is very different as the now-crowded city state is characterized by a large wealth gap between foreigners and the elite, and the struggling working class. 

Reflect

  • Based on Halid's story, how different are the gas pump attendants in your area?
  • How did you feel about Halid? Were you impressed with his work ethic, or did you feel sorry for him?

Explore

Channel News Asia. (2020, February 15). Going hungry in Singapore, a cheap food paradise. Retrieved from CNA Insider: https://youtu.be/PQaVds_uFDY

items.title: Mi Ultimo Adios by Jose Rizal
items.summary: Jose Rizal is the Philippine’s national hero and prominent writer advocating Spanish rule reform. "Mi Ultimo Adios" is Jose Rizal’s…
items.content_html:
Jose Rizal is the Philippine’s national hero and prominent writer advocating Spanish rule reform. "Mi Ultimo Adios" is Jose Rizal’s final Spanish poem before his execution after his arrest for sedition.  

Origin

Manila, Philippines

 

"My Final Farewell" in English

You can read Rizal's last work from the Jose Rizal website.

Jose Rizal University. (2003). The last poem of Rizal. Retrieved from Jose Rizal.ph: http://www.joserizal.ph/pm03.html

Explore

Rizal, J. P. (2009). El filibusterismo. Guerrero Publishing.

Rizal, J. (2019). Noli Me Tangere (Touch me not). Dover Publications.

items.title: Hello Schoolgirl /  순정만화 (2008)
items.summary: Hello Schoolgirl / 순정만화 (2008) is a charming, light-hearted comedy that follows two May-December relationships. In one, a shy public…
items.content_html:
Hello Schoolgirl / 순정만화 (2008) is a charming, light-hearted comedy that follows two May-December relationships. In one, a shy public servant in his 30s develops a singular friendship with his neighbor, an 18-year old high school student. In the other, a lovely bereaved photographer catches the eye of an immature, brash young man. 

Origin

Seoul, South Korea

 

Soo-Young and Kim Yeon-woo Meet

South Korea has somehow overtaken Japan as the most popular source of Asian music and entertainment. From K-pop to K-drama, the Korean wave (Hallyu) has slowly seeped into European and North American culture. Movies and music, however, can often be misleading and some of the cultural nuances are lost for the sake of entertainment. Work ethics, treatment of homosexuals, and May-December relationships are just some of the dynamics that are quite different from the West. Movies such as "Hello Schoolgirl", while providing light entertainment, provide a small peek into the inner workings of South Korean society. 

In the following clip, Kim Yeon-woo meets up with his neighbor Soo-Young on the way home after work. 

Reflect

  • How are relationships with a large age gap viewed in your family or in your culture?
  • Do you think the age between two adults makes a big difference between friends and couples?

Explore

Hae-rin, L. (2023, May 20). Gender divide leads to fewer Koreans dating. Retrieved from The Korea Times: https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/nation/2023/06/113_351298.html

Soto, M. (2019). South Korea 101: The culture, etiquette, rules and customs.

items.title: Hear Me / 聽說 (2009)
items.summary: Hear Me / 聽說 (2009) revolves around a food delivery boy, Tien Kuo, who develops a crush on Yang Yang,…
items.content_html:
Hear Me / 聽說 (2009) revolves around a food delivery boy, Tien Kuo, who develops a crush on Yang Yang, a hard-working girl devoted to her deaf and mute sister. Tien Kuo quickly realizes that although his Taiwan Sign Language (TSL) skills are more than adequate to communicate with Yang Yang, he realizes as their relationship progresses that there is more to communication than just language. 

Origin

Taipei, Taiwan

Yang Yang and Tien Kuo

Taiwan Sign Language (TSL) is one of the many variations of gesture-based expression. As with American Sign Language (ASL) and British Sign Language (BSL), TSL is a completely independent language of its own from Mandarin. Deaf and mute culture manifests itself in different ways in many countries. In Taiwan, inclusion of this community is important and there is always an effort to improve their condition in society.

Yang Yang and Tien Kuo finally meet in this clip from "Hear Me".

Reflect

  • Have you ever interacted with deaf-mute culture?  
  • Do you think sign language is more difficult to learn than a foreign language like Chinese or Russian?

Explore

Seek the World. (2021). https://gosignlanguage.com/learn-taiwanese-sign-language-in-54-words/. Retrieved from Seek the world: Sign language and deaf stories.

Bai, X., & Kao, G. (2019). Taipei people. The Chinese University of Hong Kong Press.

items.title: The Riot by Khushwant Singh
items.summary: Khushwant Singh was a well-known Indian writer and political commentator. His stories often took on themes of conflict within Indian…
items.content_html:
Khushwant Singh was a well-known Indian writer and political commentator.  His stories often took on themes of conflict within Indian society. “The Riot” is one of the stories included in “The Collected Short Stories of Khushwant Singh”.  

Origin

Hadali, Pakistan

 

"The Riot" short story

"The Riot" is an example of a very subtle commentary on politics and religion in South Asia. The highly stratified and violent environment of the time when the story was written made it difficult to address societal problems directly. Singh, like many proactive writers, tried to get his political messages across through his stories.  

"The Riot" can be read online from the SJSU library.

Singh, K. (2007). The Riot. New Delhi: Penguin Books Ltd. Retrieved from http://search.proquest.com.libaccess.sjlibrary.org/books/riot/docview/2138590642/se-2

Reflect

  • Do you know any North American writers that used short stories to express their political views? 
  • What do you think Khushwant Singh was trying to say about the similarities between dogs and people?

Explore

Khushwant Singh. (2007). The collected short stories of Khushwant Singh. Ravi Dayal Publisher.

Mukerji, S. (1917). Indian ghost stories. A.H. Wheeler & Co.

items.title: Zhuang Zi Speaks: The Music of Nature
items.summary: Zhuang Zi/Chuang-Tzu/Zhuangzi/莊子 was an influential writer and philosopher who discussed many topics that both countered and supported Buddhist principles. He…
items.content_html:
Zhuang Zi/Chuang-Tzu/Zhuangzi/莊子 was an influential writer and philosopher who discussed many topics that both countered and supported Buddhist principles. He was a native of the state of Meng (now located in present-day Henan province) and was born during the Warring States period in China. His ideas focused not only on the characteristics of the Dao, but also the role of nature and human existence. 

Origin

Henan province, China

Chinese Through Comics Series excerpts

Chinese philosophy has long been studied by Western scholars, but even the smallest error or misinterpretation of the translation can ruin the interpretation of the author's ideas. The quality of the translations of Chinese literature, especially literature involving philosophy, is almost always questionable. A Westerner, even one who purports to understand Chinese, can never reach a full comprehension of the subtleties of Chinese writing. Zuang Zi's writing was a product of his time and Western interpretations and readings are heavily influenced by Western philosophy. Interpretations from a Chinese writer, on the other hand, can at least provide a fair reading of Zuang Zi's philosophy.

The following comic page scans have dual-language text (English-Simplified Chinese) that serve to illustrate some of the simpler ideas of Zhuang Zi. Click on a thumbnail to view the full image.

Reflect

  • Do you agree with the ideas presented in the comic strips?
  • Do you think Zuang Zi’s ideas in the comic strips are still relevant today? 
  • Do you think Zuang Zi's ideas in the comic strips are widely different from Western thinking? 

Explore

Ware, J. Hamilton and Ames, . Roger T. (2019, April 4). Zhuangzi. Encyclopedia Britannica. https://www.britannica.com/biography/Zhuangzi

Chuang, T. (1889). Chuang Tzu: Mystic, moralist, and social reformer. Retrieved from Gutenberg.org: https://gutenberg.org/cache/epub/59709/pg59709-images.html

Chuang, T. (1974). Chuang Tsu: Inner chapters. Vintage.

items.title: Introduction to Asian Literature and Media playlist
items.summary: This playlist provides an overview of how teachers and students can be introduced to Asian literature and media. The objective…
items.content_html:
This playlist provides an overview of how teachers and students can be introduced to Asian literature and media. The objective of the playlist is to elicit learning and curiosity towards Asian history and literature via mixed media. In doing so, learners can be better prepared in communicating with Asians and dealing with misconceptions and ignorance about their culture. Moreover, by developing a rich appreciation of the culture, learners are equipped to handle negative outcomes caused by prejudices and hate.

This playlist is designed to meet the competencies and domains as they are described in the AASL Standards Framework for Learners.  

  Activity AASL Competency and Domain
1 Read the titles of the posts in the Table of Contents page and then click any of the links  to get started. Participate in an activity designed to help you think, create, share, and grow independently and within a learning community.
2 Click the map embedded on the post to check the origin of the content. You can also open Google Earth to further explore the region.

Explore

  • Exercise information gathering skills by choosing the right tools and sources.
  • Engage curiosity and actively acquire new knowledge.
3 Read, listen, or watch the content.

Inquire, Include, Collaborate, Curate

Experience content that is beyond mainstream media and literature. Engage and participate within a completely different paradigm.
4

Read the guided question and write down what comes to mind.

If you have your own questions about the content, write them down too.

Inquire - Create

  • Formulate questions about a topic.
  • Demonstrate curiosity with a new topic or theme.
5 Discuss your ideas and opinions of the content with your peers or your instructor.

Include - Think, Create, Share

  • Interact with other learners and individuals with different ideas, perspectives, and backgrounds.
  • Engage in informed conversation and debate.
6 Explore suggested readings or media related to the content.

Inquire - Grow

  • Seek additional information and continue inquiry.
  • Exercise understanding through additional resources.
